intro: Crotalaria loandae, commonly known as the African bladder nut, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which is characterized by its leguminous properties and nitrogen-fixing capabilities. The plant features showy yellow flowers and produces distinctive seed pods that resemble small bladders. Its leaves are typically trifoliate, with three leaflets arranged symmetrically. Crotalaria loandae is often found in dry savannahs and is adapted to arid conditions.
